channel.title: Midi looper internal route problem
channel.description: Hi everyone, here is my firs question, hope somebody can help, I'm trying to make a random melody generator with the ability of looping a desired loop. I've made a subpatch that creates melodies with a selected scale, range of notes and different trigger gates. the first part works and it's pretty easy. Now to loop the last bars, i'm using midi looper patch from the community library user matroe. The thing is that i don't know how to route the notes created with my subpatch to the looper. I'm just getting to loop the Din midi input. Can somebody guide me on this? thanks in advance

item.title: Midi looper internal route problem
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

I uploaded a work in progress patch of the new Looper here

Mattilyn Mattroe contributions

MIDI LOOPER PRO! So, I haven't quite finished it yet, but it's pretty stable. Needs some tidying/optimizing and stuff. I haven't uploaded to the library yet, but here's an embedded patch- midi looper PRO upload.axp (104.9 KB) If you find any bugs/have suggestions, let me know! It doesn't use a poly subpatch, which means the object is quite 'big' inside. I'm going to make some stripped back versions with less voices. It's currently set up to record 9 voices at once and play back 15. Tâ€¦

It should work recording from internal midi. If you are also playing back to internal midi use different ports otherwise when you overdub it'll try and record its own playback, I think.

Read full topic

item.title: Midi looper internal route problem
item.dc:creator: @pauk pau
item.description:
@pauk wrote:

ops I see
thanks anyways

Read full topic

item.title: Midi looper internal route problem
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

Ah, I had a look at the code in the record object and it doesn't record from the internal midi bus which is why it won't work.

I think I made it like that to stop it recording itself when sending the loop to the internal bus, which I think it needs to do to solve polyphony issues when overdubbing. I always record incoming midi so it was never an issue for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Midi looper internal route problem
item.dc:creator: @MattilynMattroe
item.description:
@MattilynMattroe wrote:

So it's working on DIN but not on the internal midi? It might be to do with the settings inside the play/record subpatch, can you screenshot those?

It's been a while since I used these (I'm actually working on a different midi Looper setup that uses less sdram).

Read full topic

item.title: Midi looper internal route problem
item.dc:creator: @pauk pau
item.description:
@pauk wrote:

Hi everyone, here is my firs question, hope somebody can help,
I'm trying to make a random melody generator with the ability of looping a desired loop.
I've made a subpatch that creates melodies with a selected scale, range of notes and different trigger gates.
the first part works and it's pretty easy.
Now to loop the last bars, i'm using midi looper patch from the community library user matroe.
The thing is that i don't know how to route the notes created with my subpatch to the looper.
I'm just getting to loop the Din midi input.
Can somebody guide me on this?
